cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 360 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn northwest then north-northwest, tracking toward the upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast before curving northeast across Arkansas and the lower-Mississippi / Tennessee valleys
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border (upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts, around Lake Charles-Port Arthur)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch east of Intracoastal City to west of Morgan City, LA; Storm Surge Watch Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX and from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm Surge Warning San Luis Pass TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River; Tropical Storm Warning Sargent TX to San Luis Pass TX and east of Intracoastal City LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts with surge penetrating up to 30 miles inland; effects later spreading inland across LA, AR, and the lower Mississippi Valley
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Kansas City not listed in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (forecast 1-2 inches possible, well below 4 inches)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: No (inland river port, far from Gulf coast)
weather_observation.wind: Remnant low may bring occasional gusts 20-30 mph but no tropical-storm-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge: None (location is more than 600 km from the Gulf)
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate to heavy rain as remnants pass Friday; localized totals 1-2 inches, isolated 3 inches possible
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief localized river/stream rises and minor flash-flood potential; isolated tornado risk across AR/MO border area but very low for Kansas City proper
